document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Argyresthia retinella Zeller, 1839: 205
. TL: Central Europe. TD: BMNH.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Argyresthia fundella Fischer von Röslerstamm
ab. albicornis
Caradja, 1920 : 92
. TL: Germany (Kasakewitsch). TD: MGAB.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male genitalia : As in Figs. 125 , 181 and 237 .

Host plants :
Salix caprea
L. ( Salicaceae ),
Betula
sp. ( Betulaceae ), and
Quercus
sp. ( Fagaceae ) ( Moriuti 1977 ).
Distribution. China ( Hebei , Ningxia , Shanxi , Yunnan , Xinjiang ), Europe, Japan , Russian Far East.

Diagnosis. In the subgenus
Argyresthia
,
A . ( A .) retinella
can be easily recognized by the white ground color of the forewing and the signum lacking horns in the female genitalia ( Fig. 283 ). It is similar to
A. ( B. ) densa
,
sp. nov.
, and a diagnosis is given under the latter species.
Remarks. The specimens examined are superficially close to the “form” claire ( Gibeaux 1983b ).
